de.systemagmbh.tools.bus
Class ASysBus

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.bus.ASysBus
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISysBus, ISysComponent
public abstract class ASysBus
extends Object
implements ISysBus

The class ASysBus may be useful for all ISysBus implementations, because it contains some generally useful methods. Last modification $Date: 2006/04/25 12:46:05 $.

Version:
$Revision: 1.16 $
Author:
Herbert Helmstreit

Method Detail

getTimeout

public long getTimeout()
Get the timeout limit in millisecs.

Specified by:
getTimeout in interface ISysBus
Returns:
the current timeout limit in milliseconds. Timeouts are currently used when requesting data from a service.
See Also:
setTimeout(long), getSecondsTimeout()

getSecondsTimeout

public double getSecondsTimeout()
Get the timeout limit in seconds.

Returns:
the current timeout limit in seconds. Timeouts are currently used when requesting data from a service.
See Also:
setTimeout(long), getTimeout()

setTimeout

public void setTimeout(long timeout)
Set the timeout limit in millisecs used with request/reply.

Specified by:
setTimeout in interface ISysBus
Parameters:
timeout - The timeout limit in millisecs to use with request/reply. Timeouts are currently used when requesting data from a service.
See Also:
getTimeout()

getHostPID

protected String getHostPID()
Get the host name and Process Id combined as String; if the host is unknown to the network or the PID cannot be determined, "unknown" is returned.

Returns:
The host name and process ID in the form "kilroy1258"

getPid

protected Long getPid()
Get the Process Id. if the PID could not be determined, -1 is returned.

Returns:
The process ID

getHost

protected String getHost()
Get the host ip number and name. if the host is unknown to the network "unknown" is returned.

Returns:
The host ip number and name in the form 130.12.145.8 (kilroy)

getTimeStamp

protected String getTimeStamp(Date date)
Format a date; see setProperty documentation how to change the format.

Parameters:
date - a Date.
Returns:
The formatted date.

getStartup

protected String getStartup()
Get the startup timestamp; see setProperty documentation how to change the format.

Returns:
The formatted date of startup.

getUpTime

protected long getUpTime()
Get the number of milliseconds the bus was up and running.

Returns:
The number of milliseconds the bus was up and running

getComponentType

public String getComponentType()
Get the type of this ASysBus.
This is used for logging by component (see configuration).

Specified by:
getComponentType in interface ISysComponent
Returns:
'bus'.

getProperty

public String getProperty(String key)
Specified by:
getProperty in interface ISysComponent
Parameters:
key - the name of the property e.g. "delivery"
Returns:
the value of the adressed property; If there is none, the component should return null.

setProperty

public void setProperty(String key,
                        String value)
                 throws ASysException
Set a CSysBus property. The following properties are evaluated by this CSysBus class.
key allowed values description
"ts_format" everything SimpleDateFormat can handle. e.g. "dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm:ss,SSS" The time stamp pattern used in bus status reports.

Specified by:
setProperty in interface ISysComponent
Parameters:
key - The name of the parameter.
value - The value of the parameter
Throws:
ASysException - Should never be thrown here
See Also:
ISysComponent.setProperty( java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

finalize

public void finalize()
              throws Throwable
Shutdown. This class holds no critical resources. We do not call removeAllServices

Specified by:
finalize in interface ISysBus
Throws:
Throwable - if super throws.

removeAllServices

public void removeAllServices()
Removes all previously added Services. This method usually is called by the Bus, when finalizing. It is seldom needed on other occasions. No Class derived from ASysBus needs to implement this.

Specified by:
removeAllServices in interface ISysBus
See Also:
ISysBus.removeAllServices()

setAddingRawSize

public void setAddingRawSize(ISysConfigItem configItem)
Sets the AddingRawSize option. This method is called as part of the initialization.

Parameters:
configItem - If this configuration item contains an item 'determine_message_size' the value of this item is converted to a boolean and can be accessed via isAddingRawSize().

isAddingRawSize

public boolean isAddingRawSize()
Gets the AddingRawSize option.

Returns:
The current AddingRawSize of type boolean
See Also:
setAddingRawSize(de.systemagmbh.interfaces.config.ISysConfigItem)
